name: Add and delete Packet Filter rules
description: Add and delete a rule on the Packet Filter (PF) if installed and enabled.

data.command:
echo "block in proto tcp from 1.2.3.4 to any" | pfctl -a pf-rules -f -
pfctl -a pf-rules -s rules

pfctl -a pf-rules -F rules
sed -i "" '/anchor pf-rules/d'
pfctl -f /etc/pf.conf

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Check if pf is installed on the machine and enabled.

data.command:
if [ ! -x "$(command -v pfctl)" ]; then echo -e "
***** PF NOT installed *****
"; exit 1; fi
if [ "$(kldstat -n pf)" = "" ]; then echo -e "
***** PF inactive *****
"; exit 1; fi

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/1
steps.description: Check if pf is installed on the machine and enabled.
